Package game.board

Class GameState

java.lang.Object
game.board.GameState
public class GameState extends Object
The GameState class represents the current state of a chess game, including turn information, captured pieces, en passant, castling rights, and other relevant details.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Ryu

  • Constructor Details

    • GameState

      public GameState(int capturedPiece, int enPassantFile, int plyCounter, boolean wKingSideCastle, boolean wQueenSideCastle, boolean bKingSideCastle, boolean bQueenSideCastle)
      Constructs a new GameState with the specified initial values.
      Parameters:
      capturedPiece - The type of the captured piece.
      enPassantFile - The file index for en passant.
      plyCounter - The half-move counter.
      wKingSideCastle - Whether white can castle kingside.
      wQueenSideCastle - Whether white can castle queenside.
      bKingSideCastle - Whether black can castle kingside.
      bQueenSideCastle - Whether black can castle queenside.

  • Method Details

    • getCastleBoard

      public long getCastleBoard(boolean isWhite)
      Gets the bitboard representing possible castle squares based on color and game state.
      Parameters:
      isWhite - Whether the color is white.
      Returns:
      The bitboard representing possible castle squares.

    • resetGameState

      public void resetGameState()
      Resets the game state, including castle rights and turn information.

      public void resetCastleRight()
